front.title: Requirements from various WG for MMUSIC

abstract.t: This document outlines some of the requirements driving varions consideration in the MMUSIC working group to meet the needs of WebRTC, CLUE, and other working groups.
This document is only meant to be used to help drive the discussion of solutions and is not intended to become an RFC.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: For the past several meetings, there has been discusion around varios mechanism to reduce the number of UDP ports needed by applications for RTP. This document attempts to capture some of the requirements that are important in selecting the solution for how to represent the SDP to negotiate the RTP media that is using reduced ports.

section.title: Terminology
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119. This document generically uses RTP to mean RTP and SRTP.

section.title: Requirements
section.t: This section covers the requirements from varios WG for setting up up media. Obviously it does not try and cover all the requirements but it tries to cover a set that seem relevant to decisions around multiplexing onto few UDP ports.

High Priority Requirements:
Lots of media flows, but only a few UDP transports flows
Supports existing and future SIP devices with a single offer/answer

Other Requirements:
Add/remove one way video flows with minimal chance of glare for RTCWeb applications that know they are working with another side that support this capability
Negotiation when both ends have different capabilities
No knowledge of capabilities of the other side before generating the SDP offer
Need uniform way to deal with new SDP parameters
Get to small number of UPD transport flow within one signaling roundtrip in cases where both sides implement all the WebRTC requirement
Can set parameters such as resolution, and perhaps bandwidth, for each RTCWeb Track
Be able to identify the RTCWeb tracks concept with a stable ID
Allow different sources (cameras) to use different codecs

section.title: Non-Requirements
section.t: Some items are not a major goal. If methods are found that work for these as well, that is great, but they are not a priority item.

list.t: Working with SIP proxies or B2BUA that are not compliant with the standards. The reason for this is it is just not possible to design for every possible thing that does not do what the standards require.
